00065 /* Base - Wrapper for referencing Objects in a Scene */

00077 typedef struct AviCodecData {
00078     void            *lpFormat;  /* save format */
00079     void            *lpParms;   /* compressor options */
00080     unsigned int    cbFormat;       /* size of lpFormat buffer */
00081     unsigned int    cbParms;        /* size of lpParms buffer */
00082 
00083     unsigned int    fccType;            /* stream type, for consistency */
00084     unsigned int    fccHandler;         /* compressor */
00085     unsigned int    dwKeyFrameEvery;    /* keyframe rate */
00086     unsigned int    dwQuality;          /* compress quality 0-10,000 */
00087     unsigned int    dwBytesPerSecond;   /* bytes per second */
00088     unsigned int    dwFlags;            /* flags... see below */
00089     unsigned int    dwInterleaveEvery;  /* for non-video streams only */
00090     unsigned int    pad;
00091 
00092     char            avicodecname[128];
00093 } AviCodecData;
00094 
00095 typedef struct QuicktimeCodecData {
00096     /*Old quicktime implementation compatibility fields, read only in 2.5 - deprecated*/
00097     void            *cdParms;   /* codec/compressor options */
00098     void            *pad;       /* padding */
00099 
00100     unsigned int    cdSize;         /* size of cdParms buffer */
00101     unsigned int    pad2;           /* padding */
00102 
00103     char            qtcodecname[128];
00104 } QuicktimeCodecData;
00105     
00106 typedef struct QuicktimeCodecSettings {
00107     /* Codec settings detailed for 2.5 implementation*/
00108     int codecType; /* Types defined in quicktime_export.h */
00109     int codecSpatialQuality; /* in 0-100 scale, to be translated in 0-1024 for qt use */
00110 
00111     /* Settings not available in current QTKit API */
00112     int codec;
00113     int codecFlags;
00114     int colorDepth;
00115     int codecTemporalQuality; /* in 0-100 scale, to be translated in 0-1024 for qt use */
00116     int minSpatialQuality; /* in 0-100 scale, to be translated in 0-1024 for qt use */
00117     int minTemporalQuality; /* in 0-100 scale, to be translated in 0-1024 for qt use */
00118     int keyFrameRate;
00119     int bitRate;    /* bitrate in bps */
00120     
00121     /* Audio Codec settings */
00122     int audiocodecType;
00123     int audioSampleRate;
00124     short audioBitDepth;
00125     short audioChannels;
00126     int audioCodecFlags;
00127     int audioBitRate;
00128     int pad1;
00129 } QuicktimeCodecSettings;

00150 } FFMpegCodecData;

00170 /* Render Layer */
00171 typedef struct SceneRenderLayer {
00172     struct SceneRenderLayer *next, *prev;
00173     
00174     char name[64];  /* MAX_NAME */
00175     
00176     struct Material *mat_override;
00177     struct Group *light_override;
00178     
00179     unsigned int lay;       /* scene->lay itself has priority over this */
00180     unsigned int lay_zmask; /* has to be after lay, this is for Z-masking */
00181     int layflag;
00182     
00183     int pad;
00184     
00185     int passflag;           /* pass_xor has to be after passflag */
00186     int pass_xor;
00187 } SceneRenderLayer;

00189 /* srl->layflag */
00190 #define SCE_LAY_SOLID   1
00191 #define SCE_LAY_ZTRA    2
00192 #define SCE_LAY_HALO    4
00193 #define SCE_LAY_EDGE    8
00194 #define SCE_LAY_SKY     16
00195 #define SCE_LAY_STRAND  32
00196     /* flags between 32 and 0x8000 are set to 1 already, for future options */
00197 
00198 #define SCE_LAY_ALL_Z       0x8000
00199 #define SCE_LAY_XOR         0x10000
00200 #define SCE_LAY_DISABLE     0x20000
00201 #define SCE_LAY_ZMASK       0x40000
00202 #define SCE_LAY_NEG_ZMASK   0x80000
00203 
00204 /* srl->passflag */
00205 #define SCE_PASS_COMBINED           (1<<0)
00206 #define SCE_PASS_Z                  (1<<1)
00207 #define SCE_PASS_RGBA               (1<<2)
00208 #define SCE_PASS_DIFFUSE            (1<<3)
00209 #define SCE_PASS_SPEC               (1<<4)
00210 #define SCE_PASS_SHADOW             (1<<5)
00211 #define SCE_PASS_AO                 (1<<6)
00212 #define SCE_PASS_REFLECT            (1<<7)
00213 #define SCE_PASS_NORMAL             (1<<8)
00214 #define SCE_PASS_VECTOR             (1<<9)
00215 #define SCE_PASS_REFRACT            (1<<10)
00216 #define SCE_PASS_INDEXOB            (1<<11)
00217 #define SCE_PASS_UV                 (1<<12)
00218 #define SCE_PASS_INDIRECT           (1<<13)
00219 #define SCE_PASS_MIST               (1<<14)
00220 #define SCE_PASS_RAYHITS            (1<<15)
00221 #define SCE_PASS_EMIT               (1<<16)
00222 #define SCE_PASS_ENVIRONMENT        (1<<17)
00223 #define SCE_PASS_INDEXMA            (1<<18)
00224 #define SCE_PASS_DIFFUSE_DIRECT     (1<<19)
00225 #define SCE_PASS_DIFFUSE_INDIRECT   (1<<20)
00226 #define SCE_PASS_DIFFUSE_COLOR      (1<<21)
00227 #define SCE_PASS_GLOSSY_DIRECT      (1<<22)
00228 #define SCE_PASS_GLOSSY_INDIRECT    (1<<23)
00229 #define SCE_PASS_GLOSSY_COLOR       (1<<24)
00230 #define SCE_PASS_TRANSM_DIRECT      (1<<25)
00231 #define SCE_PASS_TRANSM_INDIRECT    (1<<26)
00232 #define SCE_PASS_TRANSM_COLOR       (1<<27)

00238 /* Generic image format settings,
00239  * this is used for NodeImageFile and IMAGE_OT_save_as operator too.
00240  *
00241  * note: its a bit strange that even though this is an image format struct
00242  *  the imtype can still be used to select video formats.
00243  *  RNA ensures these enum's are only selectable for render output.
00244  */
00245 typedef struct ImageFormatData {
00246     char imtype;   /* R_IMF_IMTYPE_PNG, R_... */
00247                    /* note, video types should only ever be set from this
00248                     * structure when used from RenderData */
00249     char depth;    /* bits per channel, R_IMF_CHAN_DEPTH_8 -> 32,
00250                     * not a flag, only set 1 at a time */
00251 
00252     char planes;   /* - R_IMF_PLANES_BW, R_IMF_PLANES_RGB, R_IMF_PLANES_RGBA */
00253     char flag;     /* generic options for all image types, alpha zbuffer */
00254 
00255     char quality;  /* (0 - 100), eg: jpeg quality */
00256     char compress; /* (0 - 100), eg: png compression */
00257 
00258 
00259     /* --- format specific --- */
00260 
00261     /* OpenEXR */
00262     char  exr_codec;
00263 
00264     /* Cineon */
00265     char  cineon_flag;
00266     short cineon_white, cineon_black;
00267     float cineon_gamma;
00268 
00269     /* Jpeg2000 */
00270     char  jp2_flag;
00271 
00272     char pad[7];
00273 
00274 } ImageFormatData;
00275 
00276 
00277 /* ImageFormatData.imtype */
00278 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_TARGA           0
00279 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_IRIS            1
00280 /* #define R_HAMX                    2 */ /* hamx is nomore */
00281 /* #define R_FTYPE                   3 */ /* ftype is nomore */
00282 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_JPEG90          4
00283 /* #define R_MOVIE                   5 */ /* movie is nomore */
00284 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_IRIZ            7
00285 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_RAWTGA         14
00286 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_AVIRAW         15
00287 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_AVIJPEG        16
00288 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_PNG            17
00289 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_AVICODEC       18
00290 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_QUICKTIME      19
00291 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_BMP            20
00292 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_RADHDR         21
00293 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_TIFF           22
00294 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_OPENEXR        23
00295 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_FFMPEG         24
00296 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_FRAMESERVER    25
00297 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_CINEON         26
00298 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_DPX            27
00299 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_MULTILAYER     28
00300 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_DDS            29
00301 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_JP2            30
00302 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_H264           31
00303 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_XVID           32
00304 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_THEORA         33
00305 
00306 #define R_IMF_IMTYPE_INVALID        255
00307 
00308 /* ImageFormatData.flag */
00309 #define R_IMF_FLAG_ZBUF         (1<<0)   /* was R_OPENEXR_ZBUF */
00310 #define R_IMF_FLAG_PREVIEW_JPG  (1<<1)   /* was R_PREVIEW_JPG */
00311 
00312 /* return values from BKE_imtype_valid_depths, note this is depts per channel */
00313 #define R_IMF_CHAN_DEPTH_1  (1<<0) /* 1bits  (unused) */
00314 #define R_IMF_CHAN_DEPTH_8  (1<<1) /* 8bits  (default) */
00315 #define R_IMF_CHAN_DEPTH_12 (1<<2) /* 12bits (uncommon, jp2 supports) */
00316 #define R_IMF_CHAN_DEPTH_16 (1<<3) /* 16bits (tiff, halff float exr) */
00317 #define R_IMF_CHAN_DEPTH_24 (1<<4) /* 24bits (unused) */
00318 #define R_IMF_CHAN_DEPTH_32 (1<<5) /* 32bits (full float exr) */
00319 
00320 /* ImageFormatData.planes */
00321 #define R_IMF_PLANES_RGB   24
00322 #define R_IMF_PLANES_RGBA  32
00323 #define R_IMF_PLANES_BW    8
00324 
00325 /* ImageFormatData.exr_codec */
00326 #define R_IMF_EXR_CODEC_NONE  0
00327 #define R_IMF_EXR_CODEC_PXR24 1
00328 #define R_IMF_EXR_CODEC_ZIP   2
00329 #define R_IMF_EXR_CODEC_PIZ   3
00330 #define R_IMF_EXR_CODEC_RLE   4
00331 
00332 /* ImageFormatData.jp2_flag */
00333 #define R_IMF_JP2_FLAG_YCC          (1<<0)  /* when disabled use RGB */ /* was R_JPEG2K_YCC */
00334 #define R_IMF_JP2_FLAG_CINE_PRESET  (1<<1)  /* was R_JPEG2K_CINE_PRESET */
00335 #define R_IMF_JP2_FLAG_CINE_48      (1<<2)  /* was R_JPEG2K_CINE_48FPS */
00336 
00337 /* ImageFormatData.cineon_flag */
00338 #define R_IMF_CINEON_FLAG_LOG (1<<0)  /* was R_CINEON_LOG */

00591 typedef struct GameData {
00592 
00593     /*  standalone player */
00594     struct GameFraming framing;
00595     short playerflag, xplay, yplay, freqplay;
00596     short depth, attrib, rt1, rt2;
00597     short aasamples, pad4[3];
00598 
00599     /* stereo/dome mode */
00600     struct GameDome dome;
00601     short stereoflag, stereomode;
00602     float eyeseparation;
00603     RecastData recastData;
00604 
00605 
00606     /* physics (it was in world)*/
00607     float gravity; /*Gravitation constant for the game world*/
00608 
00609     /*
00610      * Radius of the activity bubble, in Manhattan length. Objects
00611      * outside the box are activity-culled. */
00612     float activityBoxRadius;
00613 
00614     /*
00615      * bit 3: (gameengine): Activity culling is enabled.
00616      * bit 5: (gameengine) : enable Bullet DBVT tree for view frustrum culling
00617      */
00618     int flag;
00619     short mode, matmode;
00620     short occlusionRes;     /* resolution of occlusion Z buffer in pixel */
00621     short physicsEngine;
00622     short exitkey, pad;
00623     short ticrate, maxlogicstep, physubstep, maxphystep;
00624     short obstacleSimulation, pad1;
00625     float levelHeight;
00626 } GameData;

00661 #define GAME_GLSL_NO_NODES                  (1 << 10)
00662 #define GAME_GLSL_NO_EXTRA_TEX              (1 << 11)
00663 #define GAME_IGNORE_DEPRECATION_WARNINGS    (1 << 12)
00664 #define GAME_ENABLE_ANIMATION_RECORD        (1 << 13)
00665 #define GAME_SHOW_MOUSE                     (1 << 14)
00666 #define GAME_GLSL_NO_COLOR_MANAGEMENT       (1 << 15)
00667 #define GAME_SHOW_OBSTACLE_SIMULATION       (1 << 16)
00668 /* Note: GameData.flag is now an int (max 32 flags). A short could only take 16 flags */
00669 
00670 /* GameData.playerflag */
00671 #define GAME_PLAYER_FULLSCREEN              (1 << 0)
00672 #define GAME_PLAYER_DESKTOP_RESOLUTION      (1 << 1)
00673 
00674 /* GameData.matmode */
00675 #define GAME_MAT_TEXFACE    0
00676 #define GAME_MAT_MULTITEX   1
00677 #define GAME_MAT_GLSL       2
00678

00835 /* *************************************************************** */

00837  */
00838 
00839 /* These settings can override the equivalent fields in the active
00840  * Brush for any paint mode; the flag field controls whether these
00841  * values are used */
00842 typedef struct UnifiedPaintSettings {
00843     /* unified radius of brush in pixels */
00844     int size;
00845 
00846     /* unified radius of brush in Blender units */
00847     float unprojected_radius;
00848 
00849     /* unified strength of brush */
00850     float alpha;
00851 
00852     /* user preferences for sculpt and paint */
00853     int flag;
00854 } UnifiedPaintSettings;
00855 
00856 typedef enum {
00857     UNIFIED_PAINT_SIZE  = (1<<0),
00858     UNIFIED_PAINT_ALPHA = (1<<1),
00859 
00860     /* only used if unified size is enabled, mirros the brush flags
00861      * BRUSH_LOCK_SIZE and BRUSH_SIZE_PRESSURE */
00862     UNIFIED_PAINT_BRUSH_LOCK_SIZE = (1<<2),
00863     UNIFIED_PAINT_BRUSH_SIZE_PRESSURE   = (1<<3),
00864 
00865     /* only used if unified alpha is enabled, mirrors the brush flag
00866      * BRUSH_ALPHA_PRESSURE */
00867     UNIFIED_PAINT_BRUSH_ALPHA_PRESSURE  = (1<<4)
00868 } UnifiedPaintSettingsFlags;

01036 /* *************************************************************** */
01037 /* Scene ID-Block */
01038 
01039 typedef struct Scene {
01040     ID id;
01041     struct AnimData *adt;   /* animation data (must be immediately after id for utilities to use it) */ 
01042     
01043     struct Object *camera;
01044     struct World *world;
01045     
01046     struct Scene *set;
01047     
01048     ListBase base;
01049     struct Base *basact;        /* active base */
01050     struct Object *obedit;      /* name replaces old G.obedit */
01051     
01052     float cursor[3];            /* 3d cursor location */
01053     float twcent[3];            /* center for transform widget */
01054     float twmin[3], twmax[3];   /* boundbox of selection for transform widget */
01055     
01056     unsigned int lay;           /* bitflags for layer visibility */
01057     int layact;     /* active layer */
01058     unsigned int lay_updated;       /* runtime flag, has layer ever been updated since load? */
01059     
01060     short flag;                             /* various settings */
01061     
01062     short use_nodes;
01063     
01064     struct bNodeTree *nodetree; 
01065     
01066     struct Editing *ed;                             /* sequence editor data is allocated here */
01067     
01068     struct ToolSettings *toolsettings;      /* default allocated now */
01069     struct SceneStats *stats;               /* default allocated now */
01070 
01071     /* migrate or replace? depends on some internal things... */
01072     /* no, is on the right place (ton) */
01073     struct RenderData r;
01074     struct AudioData audio;
01075     
01076     ListBase markers;
01077     ListBase transform_spaces;
01078     
01079     void *sound_scene;
01080     void *sound_scene_handle;
01081     void *sound_scrub_handle;
01082     void *speaker_handles;
01083     
01084     void *fps_info;                 /* (runtime) info/cache used for presenting playback framerate info to the user */
01085     
01086     /* none of the dependency graph  vars is mean to be saved */
01087     struct  DagForest *theDag;
01088     short dagisvalid, dagflags;
01089     short recalc;               /* recalc = counterpart of ob->recalc */
01090 
01091     short pad6;
01092     int pad5;
01093 
01094     /* User-Defined KeyingSets */
01095     int active_keyingset;           /* index of the active KeyingSet. first KeyingSet has index 1, 'none' active is 0, 'add new' is -1 */
01096     ListBase keyingsets;            /* KeyingSets for this scene */
01097     
01098     /* Game Settings */
01099     struct GameFraming framing  DNA_DEPRECATED; // XXX  deprecated since 2.5
01100     struct GameData gm;
01101 
01102     /* Units */
01103     struct UnitSettings unit;
01104     
01105     /* Grease Pencil */
01106     struct bGPdata *gpd;
01107 
01108     /* Physics simulation settings */
01109     struct PhysicsSettings physics_settings;
01110 
01111     /* Movie Tracking */
01112     struct MovieClip *clip;         /* active movie clip */
01113 
01114     uint64_t customdata_mask;   /* XXX. runtime flag for drawing, actually belongs in the window, only used by object_handle_update() */
01115     uint64_t customdata_mask_modal; /* XXX. same as above but for temp operator use (gl renders) */
01116 } Scene;

01154 #define R_NO_OVERWRITE  0x400000 /* skip existing files */

01287 /* depricate this! */
01288 #define TESTBASE(v3d, base)  (                                                \
01289     ((base)->flag & SELECT) &&                                                \
01290     ((base)->lay & v3d->lay) &&                                               \
01291     (((base)->object->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_VIEW)==0)  )
01292 #define TESTBASELIB(v3d, base)  (                                             \
01293     ((base)->flag & SELECT) &&                                                \
01294     ((base)->lay & v3d->lay) &&                                               \
01295     ((base)->object->id.lib==NULL) &&                                         \
01296     (((base)->object->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_VIEW)==0)  )
01297 #define TESTBASELIB_BGMODE(v3d, scene, base)  (                               \
01298     ((base)->flag & SELECT) &&                                                \
01299     ((base)->lay & (v3d ? v3d->lay : scene->lay)) &&                          \
01300     ((base)->object->id.lib==NULL) &&                                         \
01301     (((base)->object->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_VIEW)==0)  )
01302 #define BASE_EDITABLE_BGMODE(v3d, scene, base)  (                             \
01303     ((base)->lay & (v3d ? v3d->lay : scene->lay)) &&                          \
01304     ((base)->object->id.lib==NULL) &&                                         \
01305     (((base)->object->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_VIEW)==0))
01306 #define BASE_SELECTABLE(v3d, base)  (                                         \
01307     (base->lay & v3d->lay) &&                                                 \
01308     (base->object->restrictflag & (OB_RESTRICT_SELECT|OB_RESTRICT_VIEW))==0  )
01309 #define BASE_VISIBLE(v3d, base)  (                                            \
01310     (base->lay & v3d->lay) &&                                                 \
01311     (base->object->restrictflag & OB_RESTRICT_VIEW)==0  )

01321 #define ID_NEW(a)       if( (a) && (a)->id.newid ) (a)= (void *)(a)->id.newid
01322 #define ID_NEW_US(a)    if( (a)->id.newid) {(a)= (void *)(a)->id.newid; (a)->id.us++;}
01323 #define ID_NEW_US2(a)   if( ((ID *)a)->newid) {(a)= ((ID *)a)->newid; ((ID *)a)->us++;}
